name: Linda R. Petzold
content: Computational Science and Engineering Research Group | UC Santa Barbara Skip to main content Welcome to the Computational Science and Engineering Research Group We focus on mathematical modeling and machine learning, applied to networked systems in biology and medicine.Current projects include development of algorithms and software for both simulation and inference of discrete stochastic systems, uses of machine learning applied to medical data to improve the care of trauma patients, mathematical modeling of brain processes in migraine, unraveling neural communication in learning, inference of network structure of communities of neurons, and mathematical modeling of the process of cell polarization. Announcements & News Yuqing Passes Proposal Exam Congratulations to Yuqing Wang for passing her Proposal Exam in Computer Science on June 8, 2022. Dengxian (Dara) Passes MAE Congratulations to Dengxian (Dara) Yang for successfully passing her Major Area Exam (MAE) in Computer Science on June 6, 2022! Richard Jiang Graduates! Richard Jiang successfully defended his PhD thesis in Computer Science in October. Richard is now a Data Science Consultant at Accenture. Congratulations, Richard! Bruno Jacob Graduates! On, Monday, August 2, 2021, Bruno successfully defended his thesis in Mechanical Engineering. Bruno is staying local and accepted a job at Carpe Data in Santa Barbara. Congratulations, Bruno! James Bird Graduates! James successfully defended his thesis on 5/12/2021. James will begin his post-PhD career at the University of Colorado at Boulder.
